alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; Santa Fe Metro Area; West Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 23 at 1:41AM MDT until March 23 at 9:00AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM MDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations 2 to 4 inches around Santa Fe and in the west central and Sandia/Manzano mountains. Up to 2 inches around the Albuquerque Metro. * WHERE...Middle Rio Grande Valley including the Albuquerque Metro Area, Sandia and Manzano Mountains including Edgewood, West Central Highlands, and Santa Fe Metro Area. * WHEN...Until 9 AM MDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on snow packed and icy road conditions. This includes portions of I-40. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday morning commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; Santa Fe Metro Area; West Central Highlands
